title: Palmeras Houses / PRODUCTORA
description: The Palmeras project consists of five small houses of 100 m2 with 2 bedrooms, a living room, a dining room, a small pool, a rooftop and a parking space. This complex is located on the coast of Oaxaca on a lot approximately 250 meters from the beach. The lots where the houses are designed have a frontage facing the street of approximately 6 meters wide and an average depth of 21 meters inland.
author: Andreas Luco

title: Palenque Station - Maya Train / DAFdf arquitectura Y urbanismo
description: The Palenque Station is part of the Maya Train Project, a development and infrastructure railway project of nearly 1500 km in circuit in the Yucat√°n Peninsula, Mexico. Palenque is the terminal station of the Maya Train and connects to the railway network of the rest of the country. Its geographical position is diagonally opposite to the consolidated tourism core of the peninsula, in Quintana Roo. The main interest lies in the well-known Maya archaeological site "Palenque" nestled in the Chiapas jungle.
author: Andreas Luco

title: Temperaturas Extremas incorporates bird nests into tree-like Luxembourg water tower
description: This elevated water tower by Spanish studio Temperaturas Extremas is designed to camouflage with trees in a forest in Luxembourg and provide shelter for nesting birds and bats. title: Atelier Archiplein updates 1960s lakeside villa in France
description: Swiss architecture studio Atelier Archiplein has refurbished and extended La Villa house in Annecy, France, renewing the home's dated interiors. Situated on a hillside overlooking Annecy Lake, the 1960s home was in need of updating as its "single-purpose rooms" were no longer practical for contemporary use. title: A Dark Brick Exterior For A Home Surrounded By Trees
